item.title: Level 3 Network Connections Into Mexico
item.description: Businesses operating in Mexico or multinational companies with a significant Mexican presence are receiving positive news from Level 3 Communications. The company has initiated a major project to provide high-bandwidth packet network services to businesses across Mexico. Level 3 identifies a business opportunity in Mexico that other carriers, except the incumbent Telemex, may overlook. Level 3’s recent acquisition of Global Crossing, an international bandwidth competitor with significant network connectivity in Latin America, is highly advantageous.

item.title: Ethernet Exchange For Miami, Dallas and Los Angeles
item.description: Carrier Ethernet is emerging as a strong contender to replace the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN), as evidenced by the increasing number of Ethernet Exchanges that facilitate traffic sharing among carriers. Telx, a prominent interconnection and colocation provider, recently expanded its Ethernet Exchange services to Miami, Dallas, and Los Angeles. Let’s examine the significance of Ethernet Exchange and its impact on the future of international wide-area networking. The PSTN’s global reach and interoperability have contributed to its longstanding success, enabling communication between any two phones worldwide.
